website_summaries.verdict: Simple and lightweight, this inexpensive cot is sufficient for many consumers. It provides the best deal for the lowest price.
cons: At 74 inches long, taller people may dangle their feet

customer_reviews.title: Nice dog bed... I mean cot.  :)
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to setup. Took a little muscle to get some of the parts in place. May have to order another because my dogs took it over and I don't have the heart to deprive them of their new bed.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Parker

customer_reviews.title: Nice and compact.
customer_reviews.text: The bed was easy to assemble, however the last step to connect the legs was most difficult and require some muscle-power. I broke a sweat after on the first one and took a break. I just received the bed and haven't used it yet so unable to comment on comfort, however the material seems durable and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: User 001

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality product
customer_reviews.text: We just received them via ups and my daughter and I put it together in less than 10 minutes right out of the package. Seems like good quality material and stitching. The framework is solid and I imagine will hold up for a long time when taken care of. We tried it out with a sleeping bag on top and it's very comfortable. Just make sure the holes are aligned. It was a bit challenging for my 14 yr old daughter to install the feet. Takes some strength.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and well built.
customer_reviews.text: As a scout grandpaw we do a lot of camping. This is a little heavy so you're not going to use it on long hikes in the woods. My old cot was an original wooden army cot and much heavier than this one so no big deal. 90 % of the time it's a short walk to the campsite so the weight is no problem. This is easy to set up and the supporting legs are designed so they will not poke holes in the tent floor like some of the other cheaper cots.
customer_reviews.author: Verified/Frequent Buyer

customer_reviews.title: comfortable camp cot
customer_reviews.text: This cot makes an enormous difference for an aging camper like me. I'm 47, 6'1", 200lbs, and I can't remember the last time I slept comfortably in a ground tent. Tossing, turning, aches and pains, even with a good bigagnes inflatable. I slept straight through the night on this cot! I camp out of the Jeep mostly, so the weight and size aren't a big factor. Unfortunately, this cot takes up most of the space in a 2-man tent (Marmot Limelight), so even though it's great for solo camping, it doesn't leave room for a mate.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping and scouts
customer_reviews.text: This is a winner for parents under 6ft, and for children. I bought two of these for cubscouts and they are great! They do require a bit of learning to set them up the first time. Once you get the hang of it, they are pretty easy, and they are super comfy. The best way to describe it would be like sleeping on a trampoline. There are no cross supports to dig into your back or hips. It's a clever design at a good price. Enjoy!
customer_reviews.author: Matt H

customer_reviews.title: Girl Scout Leader approved!
customer_reviews.text: I left my bigger cot in the mountains and needed this one in a pinch for a Girl Scout overnight. Once I figured out how to put it together (took 5 while minutes), it was simple. Lightweight, perfect for our camp-in’s. Then I had the BEST camp-in sleep ever on this cot! None of the other adults slept, and I slept well. Lightweight, not firm, not noisy like my Coleman cot, very compact and easy to set up and break down. This one will be my cot of choice. Great price and very comfortable. Held my 200-pound body with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Great item, but think ahead about how you will use them
customer_reviews.text: These worked great (a little tight to assemble, but that makes for a snug sturdy fit), and they are very comfortable to sleep on. Exactly as described, and a great value. The two things I would mention to watch out for are 1) they are 10 pounds, which is actually pretty heavy for camping gear. Make sure you are OK with the weight. and 2) when you sleep on these, you tend to get cold from below, which would be great in summer, but in cooler weather add a pad for an extra thermal layer or you will be freezing, as we were the first time we used them!
customer_reviews.author: MGid

customer_reviews.title: I like this cot!
customer_reviews.text: This cot is the answer to my camping prayers. I'm too old for sleeping on just a pad, I have bad luck with air mattresses deflating, and military style cots dig into my hips where the middle legs cross as the fabric sags. I've spent several comfortable nights on this cot. It does require some strength to assemble. My wife can't put it together. But the comfort is worth the strain for me. My only wish is that it was a little bigger. Packs up small. Good for car camping.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: There were a number of reviews by folks saying this cot was really difficult to put together - that the braces were so rigid that they really struggled to insert them into the side rails. Neither my friend nor I had any problems AT ALL, and we're both just average over-50 women. I have slept comfortably on it but I do wish the fabric was breathable. It becomes damp from trapped body heat, but does dry quickly. All-in-all this is a good cot for car camping - sturdy, easy to set up, and beats laying on lumpy ground.
customer_reviews.author: PractiGal

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty comfortable once it's set up, but it's sort of a pain to get together. It's pretty low to the ground, which may be good or bad, depending on what you're looking for. For the price, it's a great cot, and it's comfortable. If you're going to use it a lot, you might want to go with something that's a little easier to set up, like the Coleman Pack Away.
customer_reviews.author: DesertMom

customer_reviews.title: ... the price and the compact storage - this is awesome. I bought some more expensive cots
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the compact storage - this is awesome. I bought some more expensive cots, but they were heavier and larger to store. I actually bought 2, this one and another to compare and this one won by a longslide. I do agree with other reviewers, you cannot stand on it and when pushing my knees in one place and reaching over I do feel like I am stretching the fabric weird. After a couple of uses you can see where the fabric is stretched. It doesn't feel stretched - so I'm hoping it stays tight. I would for sure recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Court

customer_reviews.title: Good cot, just a bit of a hassle to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Well it is comfortable and packs down into a tidy little package. For the price I won’t complain. I like that the part of the legs that is on the floor is the rounded part; no risk of puncturing the bottom of a tent. It does take some time to assemble, and a little bit of space.
customer_reviews.author: ride

customer_reviews.title: I use this for car camping, and it is a great value!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for car camping. It is way too heavy and large for me to go backpacking with. I followed the directions for setup the first time and it is not difficult! Tipping the cot up on edge while compressing the steel legs allowed me to get them into the holes in the frame. No big deal at all! I put a Thermarest pat on top of the cot, and am amazed at how comfortable it is! Not just "comfortable for a camp cot", but comfortable for sleeping, period! I prefer this to most sofabeds! For the money, it is an amazing deal, and I'd buy it again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Kindling

customer_reviews.title: Great for a kid...not for adults...
customer_reviews.text: My 15 year old son used this for our recent camping trip. He is about 140 pounds and 6 feet tall. (Tall and skinny) :) This cot was ok... It lasted the 3 day trip, but I wish that I had spent more money on a larger one. This would be perfect for a small child or a short adult. If you weight over 150lbs, go for a bigger and better quality cot. This sits low to the ground, so it would be perfect for a small child. I wouldn't recommend for an adult.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah&Austin Adams

customer_reviews.title: As others have noted 1) its heavy so it's good for cramping
customer_reviews.text: I am tall Hanover 6'6". A about 260 lbs. I used this cot four a four night camping trip. It functioned perfectly even though I am over the rated weight limit. As others have noted 1) its heavy so it's good for cramping. 2) it takes some strength to assemble.my wife quickly delegated the assembly of her cot to me That said, we both agree the cost provide comfort like a real mattress. And more comfort than the inflatable queen mattress and low end self inflating pads we tried before. This thing fits our car camping style and is sturdy. Well worth the modest price. IMHO the best item at its price point.
customer_reviews.author: History guy

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It's easy to set up and very comfy. I'm 220 lbs and 5'10" and it fits me fine. It's close to the ground so it doesn't touch the sides of the tent. I just ordered a 2nd one for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, but muscles needed for assembly!
customer_reviews.text: The cot is comfortable and study. I do not camp or sleep on it, I use it for lounging on my back deck, so I cannot give you an overnight comfort review. While the directions for assembly are fairly simple, you need some arm strength to pull the cross bars into position.
customer_reviews.author: L. A. Erie

customer_reviews.title: Nice little cot, sturdy and efficient design
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems really simple, then once it's setup it's kind of elegant in a way. It's a bit narrow, but you'd expect that from a packable cot. It's actually pretty comfortable still. It sets up easy. I had no issue getting the poles in, so maybe the people that had trouble just needed to find a better point of leverage. That can make all the difference if you're not fighting yourself. Once it's setup it is pretty sturdy, but you're not so sure about it while it's being put together.
customer_reviews.author: J. Marble

customer_reviews.title: The build quality is nice and I bet it would have lasted a long ...
customer_reviews.text: I slept on this one night and returned it. The build quality is nice and I bet it would have lasted a long time, I just didn't like how much it bowed in the middle. I weigh 200lbs so that could have been the problem. It was easy to set up and nice to transport and take down. So if you are lighter or don't mind a sagging cot this might not be a bad option.
customer_reviews.author: Jonsey Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Perfect cot for car camping and wide enough for side sleepers
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot. It is secure, wide (great for side sleeping), and gentle on the tent floor. You can stash things under it, and it folds down to a reasonable size for packing in the car. The cot is a bit tight when you set it up (hint - insert the rods with the holes facing towards the inside!) but after the first camp out it got easier to set up. We love this so much we're getting a full set for the family!
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Rake

customer_reviews.title: Solid cot
customer_reviews.text: I use this strictly for when I am car camping. The first time I used it the supports were hard to squeeze into the fabric but after using it a couple times it was easier. I am 5’9” and weight 155 lbs. I found that laying my sleeping pad on top of the mat would alleviate pressure off my hip and shoulders. I highly recommend this cot for its comfort and quick set up!
customer_reviews.author: Christina S.

customer_reviews.title: best sleep ever
customer_reviews.text: i actually bought this as a guest bed in my nyc apartment. i have a studio so when guests visit, there's very little space to put them. it is SO comfortable i use it for napping myself. as far as the weight recommendation, my husband, myself and 3 dogs actually can sleep all together (easily over 300 lbs)...don't ask me why we would do this, but we have :) we call it the "cot of morpheus". i did not give 5 stars as it was hell to put together, tho having read the previous reviews, i see there is an easier way to assemble then we chose. i am buying another for my son's apt today. amazingly good sleep.
customer_reviews.author: loki

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Cot, Great Price.
customer_reviews.text: We just returned from a camping trip and this Camp Cot is very comfortable and easier to pack than our air mattress. I slept great on this, woke up with no back pain or stiffness at all. I am 6' 1", 185 lbs and the cot performed just great, it could be a little wider but I knew the dimensions before I purchased so that is on me, not the company. Easy to assemble, took less than 3 minutes, breakdown was the same and it all fits into a carrying case that is provided. I'm not sure what the more expensive cots do that this one doesn't do, save your money and give this one a try.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent comfort, excellent value!
customer_reviews.text: Super compact when stored, super comfortable when assembled. I’m 6’5”, 220lbs and I fit fine and sleep like a rock on this thing. There’s some springiness to the cot by nature of the design, which I found to be more comfortable than a traditional cot. Very light weight yet very durable. It takes a bit of muscle to assemble, but really not too bad. Quite possibly the best cot at this price. I bought two and I give them my highest recommendation
customer_reviews.author: Sohn

customer_reviews.title: or the assembly needs to be accomplished by someone who is much stronger than I am---and I am in good shape. I will be returning this
customer_reviews.text: almost impossible to assemble. i understand about tension being necessary, but either what I was sent is defective, or the assembly needs to be accomplished by someone who is much stronger than I am---and I am in good shape. I will be returning this. Very annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: ennis

customer_reviews.title: Huge improvement over a pad
customer_reviews.text: Such a massive improvement to sleeping in a tent! Getting the poles that bend in can be a bit tricky, but I found it easy to insert one end near my body and reach across, pulling the other side (like a rowing machine) until it bent enough to fit. Suggest putting it together at home and leaving assembled for a day or so to allow fabric to stretch a bit. Seems to make for easier assembly at camp. Used it with a thermalrest pad and basic bag, was very comfortable, warm, and dry. Bought for me, and will probably by more for other family members.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Good basic cot for camping
customer_reviews.text: We bought this before a weekend camping trip. When packed, it's amazingly small. It assembles in about five minutes and is fairly comfortable. Other reviews mentioned severe difficulty putting it together, but that definitely was not my experience. Although I have an idea what they were doing wrong. It's difficult to describe, but when assembling the long side rails, put the pieces into each other from within the sleeve. I think people were trying to assemble those rails and then insert them into the sleeve, which would make it much more difficult.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Ringsmuth

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: This worked perfectly for me. I needed it for a long weekend camping because the last time I had gone I found that I wasn't young enough to sleep on hard ground anymore and not be sore the next day. It's a tad difficult to get the metal poles into their respective holes under the cot. But I realize if it were easy then the cot probably wouldn't be taut enough to sleep on. I had a comfortable 3 nights sleeping on the cot, with my sleeping bag on top of it to sleep in. It stores compactly which we like, and overall I'd say I was please with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Jen J

customer_reviews.title: THis is a good cot. It is easy to set up and ...
customer_reviews.text: THis is a good cot. It is easy to set up and it is lighter than some other options on the market, That was important to me because I do airplane camping and keeping my weight down is important. I do wish it was a bit taller so I could store items under it in my tent. I have a small tent and having all of my camping gear spread around the cot makes the tent a crowded place. The ones that were tall enough for storage under them were too heavy, so this was the cot that I chose. I will keep my eyes open for a tall and lightweight cot though!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent but should be higher off the ground.
customer_reviews.text: There is a learning curve to assembling these cots, but then it becomes fairly easy. I'm old and, for me, the cot should be about a foot higher off the ground. It is very comfortable with a pad under it.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick J. Spector

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but HEAVY
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected ... however, it is NOT light by ANY stretch. If you are packing your stuff in to your camp this is NOT a good option! One weighs as much as (if not more) my pack with 2 days worth of food (MRE's) and clothes for 2 people. We drove to our campsite with these and they worked perfectly. We were able to fit two in our two person tent with a little room to spare. Also, if you don't have a lot of arm strength it can be tricky to get the supports put in place.
customer_reviews.author: M. Herron

customer_reviews.title: saved my life!
customer_reviews.text: I WILL NOT GO CAMPING WITHOUT IT! I have bought many different sleeping pads in the past and let just say this thing has made camping more enjoyable for me! i love this cot and its so comfortable that I sleep so well throughout the night with no back pains in the morning. :) loving this product!
customer_reviews.author: February

customer_reviews.title: It is very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally write reviews, but I love this. We travel alot and like for our 5 year old to have his own bed. He out grew his toddler cot and I didn't want an inflatable one. This is low to the ground, the rods aren't in his back and the mat I ordered gives him extra comfort. He has room to grow. I had to use a little muscle to put the legs in, but I had it assembled in 15 min. I would buy again
customer_reviews.author: Tajuana W.

customer_reviews.title: Overall for the price not a bad cot. I am not giving it more stars ...
customer_reviews.text: Overall for the price not a bad cot. I am not giving it more stars for the following reasons: 1. While inserting and removing the side rods they come apart. Nothing that a crimp with a shifting wrench will not solve. 2. The sleeve in the fabric for the long rods is about an 18th of an inch too short making inserting the rods a bit of a struggle. Also I am about 230lbs if you are any heaver your mid section will probably be on the ground. I had to put a lot of weight on the legs to get them inserted. if this is for a smaller individual they may have a problem setting up this cot.
customer_reviews.author: Rory Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great little cot
customer_reviews.text: I have used this cot on two short 3 day camping trips so far and really enjoy it. It's a bit of a pain to set up so I gave it 4 stars. The long side poles are loose on 2 ends so they fall off while trying to insert into the fabric. And getting that first leg on is a bit tricky. But not so difficult I would return it. Looking forward to more adventures with this cot.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie M. Mulder

customer_reviews.title: Car camping and mild backpacking approved.
customer_reviews.text: Strong, durable and big. Comfortable! This thing sets up about 6" wider that my old folding cot. The stands are designed to allow the cot to flex as the fabric moves, adding to comfort. It only sits a foot off the ground, not prmitting of much storage under the cot. This thing is a PAIN to set up the first time and its rather heavy maybe not the best for ultralight backpackers but it fits my alps freight frame with no effort. Broken down its roughly 3'x3"x8". I packs farely flat. Loses one star for weight, height, packed size and it being a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Skwurlito

customer_reviews.title: Love these
customer_reviews.text: These are WONDERFUL! I have a terrible back but I love camping. These cots made my night so pleasant and they are comfortable. They are kind of a pain to build but it's most definitely not difficult, just give a little time and make sure the holes are all lined up before you start putting in the feet. I would definitely recommend this product if you are looking for a low profile cot that doesn't take up much space when collapsed.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene

customer_reviews.title: Awesome and for the price you can't go wrong!
customer_reviews.text: Bought 5 of these for my family for a Cub Scout fall campout. Setup is a bit time consuming of course compared to unrolling a pad but what do you expect. Weather got down to low 50s and ended up raining, so I was glad to be off the ground. For the price you can't beat it, their likely not a cot your going to use a ton but for the occasional weekend car camper their awesome. Pretty durable as well, a weekend with three kids jumping and moving around on them proves their strength in my book.
customer_reviews.author: J. Abshire

customer_reviews.title: ... of an air mattress for guests and they are great! We have terrible luck with air mattresses and ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought 2 of these instead of an air mattress for guests and they are great! We have terrible luck with air mattresses and got tired of replacing them after only a few uses so we opted for cots. I have slept on them as well as guests and they are very comfortable and I have no complaints, plus they pack down really small and will be great for camping. They are also a really good length for my SO who is over 6ft tall and was worried that his feet would hang off the edge but they do not!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny MacKenzie

customer_reviews.title: Easy. Solid. Simple.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up once you figure out how to do it. I'm sure there's a better way to design the rails, but it works well enough. I leave the rails assembled in my boat and just install the base when we need an extra bed. Fairly comfortable with a memory foam topper, but then again what isn't. Feels like it might be flimsy given that the base joints don't have any real lateral resistance, but it hasn't broken with me (175 lbs) laying on it plus a 40 lb kid and a 25 lb kid jumping on me off the adjacent bed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I know a lot of reviewers had a problem setting this thing up but if you have ever had to put a new string on a Bow it's no big deal. I'm 60 and totally out of shape and it was a piece of cake. Considering the other light weight cots that cost between 200 and $300 dollar this is a great alternative for car camping. Yes it's right at 10 pounds but sleep on one of these compared to a self blow up mat and there is no comparison.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Ward

customer_reviews.title: They are comfy and they set yup pretty easily. I am 6'-1" and weight 180# and ...
customer_reviews.text: They are comfy and they set yup pretty easily. I am 6'-1" and weight 180# and i fit comfortably on it. they are VERY heavy (like 10 lbs) so don't plan on carrying it backpacking! i am not sure about the longevity because I've only used it once, but it was fine for the one night i used the two i bought. They seem well constructed and for the price I will be happy with a few seasons' use out of them.
customer_reviews.author: Bicyclebradley

customer_reviews.title: I’m 6’1” 220lbs and it holds me just fine. It’s VERY SOLID
customer_reviews.text: Just BUY IT! I’m 6’1” 220lbs and it holds me just fine. It’s VERY SOLID, well designed and clearly is capable of holding more weight. And it’s comfortable to sleep on. Absolutely the best value when size/portability is preferable. This will permanently replace our Coleman ultra comfortable cots that are simply overly bulky.
customer_reviews.author: PSH

customer_reviews.title: Nice and tight, no middle bar
customer_reviews.text: We needed emergency beds in our basement for overflow over Thanksgiving weekend and purchased two. These really are very tight. No sags. No uncomfortable center bar. We had inflatable camping mats and put on top for a little extra padding. My nieces (two gals in their 50's) who had the honor of sleeping on them thought they were comfortable. They's be perfect for kids sleepovers, I think.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: Sleeps like a full size cot, portable and easy
customer_reviews.text: the only thing is that the assembly wasn't super easy because someone in manufacturing put an end cap on the wrong end of one of the side poles. Once I figured it out, easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: great to have if you camp a lot or nd ...
customer_reviews.text: great to have if you camp a lot or nd one in the car for days you may get stuck at work. for me its the latter. It folds up into a bag that is about the length of a tall umbrella and it has a shoulder strap. very handy to carry in the car . doesn't take up much space at all. the bed itself is about the size of a sleeping bag. It doesn't stand that tall off of the ground but it beats laying on the floor. its comfy and secure
customer_reviews.author: GN.

customer_reviews.title: Great Option for Scouters
customer_reviews.text: I used this cat on a scout camp out for the first time a couple weeks ago. I added a self inflating air pad and slept like a baby. Actually the other scouters were jealous. I really did not expect to have as comfortable night of sleep as I did. That being said, it is difficult to put together and takes a lot of arm strength. I'm not sure I could assemble it in my tent and instead assembled it outside. This would be problematic if there were rain.
customer_reviews.author: Tammayrend

customer_reviews.title: I didnt like the assembly that you have to do every time ...
customer_reviews.text: You have to use a little muscle to assemble. I didnt like the assembly that you have to do every time you put up and take down--the reason for 4 stars. If you get sea sick on air mattresses this isn't for you. The cot material is flexible but the design is incredibly sturdy. I (145 pounds), sat on the edge of one end, didn't tip. I rolled like a restless sleeper, didn't tip.
customer_reviews.author: Melli

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good product
customer_reviews.text: Is the perfect size for my campaign tent. Love that it's very easy to assemble and is not very hard to pull apart. I did my research before buying this cot, it took me a while, but I decided to get these one because putting together it was more easier that the other brands and their reviews were good too.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great product at a great price. if you want a great night when camping this is the equipment you need. Don't expect the conditions of a regular bed but this is much better than sleeping on the floor, here you will get real rest. Just don't exceed the specs on the product and you will enjoy. This cot gets ready in 3 minutes and you don't need to be rambo to set it up.
customer_reviews.author: SergioArb

customer_reviews.title: worked out well
customer_reviews.text: Got two of these for my grandkids to sleep on when visiting. Once I got the hang of putting the first one together (and there's nothing wrong with the design, I just don't put a cot together every day) the second one was easy. And it comes apart and stores in the bag quickly too. I tried them out myself before the visit, and they are amazingly comfortable. (not like the cots from years ago--no horizontal bars in your back!) The blue color doesn't "scream" at you, which makes them attractive in a non-camping situation. And they're able to be wiped clean to boot. Nice product.
customer_reviews.author: ctmimi

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance after reading the reviews and bought this for camping and to use as an extra bed when my kids have friends come over. It is exceptionally well made and much more comfortable than I anticipated. I like that it is so wide. It is too heavy for backpacking but it works great when I am kayak camping. Great product at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorsy

customer_reviews.title: Bang for your Buck
customer_reviews.text: The Value for this cot is unreal it works well and for the price I doubt it can be beaten the only problem I had was it rocks back when you get on it and assembly is a little difficult but once you have it down it’s easy
customer_reviews.author: Oof

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids travel, packs super thin!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our kids to use when traveling. It's nice that it's low to the ground and the kids say it's comfortable! It doesn't easily tip over either which is a definite plus when kids are using it. It packs incredibly thinly so space is no issue when traveling with it.
customer_reviews.author: Illinikayaker

customer_reviews.title: One of the best investments I have made for camping
customer_reviews.text: One of the best investments I have made for camping. Usually sleep on the ground and decided this was worth a try. Not only is it easy to set up (Bit harder if you've been drinking all night) but makes all the difference when camping outdoors. Pretty light as well and I enjoy how it folds up into a bag like those foldup camping chairs. Seriously, if you have been sleeping on the ground while camping and would like to change it up a bit give this a go. Well worth the investment.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this! I slept as well as I do on an air mattress. It is a little tough to get the legs in, but I was able to do it with very little trouble. It helps to kneel on one side, put the keg in the hike closest to you first, then pull it towards you to get the leg in to the opposite side. Also, you may want to make sure your tent floor is sturdy enough to handle the pressure. Overall I'm very glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Margeau Hawk

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Does what is says
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my son and I to use camping. He is 90 lbs, I am double that. They were easy to lay out per the directions, and I put them together in 5 minutes. The hardest part was getting the legs to go in the side support bars. Basically it is lining up holes and putting bar ends into the holes to create and maintain tension. Anyway, they have performed flawlessly and my son has decided to sleep in his for the past week and a half. He thinks it is more comfortable than his own bed. It's close, but I like my bed better.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, compact
customer_reviews.text: Was a little worried about some of the complaints about assembly but decided to give it a shot. This cot is extremely comfortable though that's coming from someone who has always slept on a camp pad when tenting it. It actually is quite heavy duty and fits in a bag about the size of a folding chair. The ONLY downside is it may be a little difficult for someone who has any strength issue to assemble as you have to compress the steel W style legs a bit during assembly.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: but I'm pretty weak and I could do it
customer_reviews.text: Takes a while to figure out how to assemble the first time, but once you've got it figured out it only takes a minute. Some muscle is required to put the legs in, but I'm pretty weak and I could do it. Very happy with my choice to purchase these. I used them for camping in a rocky area... I slept better on these cots than I do on my bed at home. Super comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Suited our needs
customer_reviews.text: We went on a family trip and needed something for our daughter who still wets the bed. This worked out perfectly. It was relatively easy to set up and take down (we were in a different hotel every night ), and it was sturdy (she's a big 8 year old). It is a little loud as you move around on it, but I guess that's to be expected for a cot.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie D

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable. The only downside is that you need to ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very impressed with these cots. Very comfortable. The only downside is that you need to have some upper arm strength to get the bottom supports lined up and locked into place (hence the four stars). My brother in law put one together with ease. My sister and I struggled a little, but it wasn't impossible. Super light and breaks down to a reasonable size - AND these fit back into the bags they arrived in!!!! (A pleasant surprise.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great cot. Great price
customer_reviews.text: Great cot. Great price. However, it's REALLY hard to get the poles set the first couple of times. I set it up in my living room the night before we went camping. I'm glad I did. The first time was pretty miserable... The second time was MUCH better. I'm sure it'll continue to get easier. It was comfortable to sleep on as well. It's a little heavier than I expected, but I'm not backpacking with it, so it's not that big of a deal..
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Butler Jr.

customer_reviews.title: when I finally decided to use it I don't feel like going through the trouble of setting it up
customer_reviews.text: Not something to set up on a whim. I bought this for occasional use down stairs for nights I have trouble sleeping. Problem is, when I finally decided to use it I don't feel like going through the trouble of setting it up. It's an OK design for portability though. I'm looking forward to using it camping, but I should have bought one of those that are easier to set up and assemble quickly and easily when needed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Best cot for under $40
customer_reviews.text: Initial reaction is good. Cot assembled fairly easily. It is held by tension so there was some pushing/pulling but nothing too demanding. I'm 5'9'', 200 lbs and it seems to hold me well. Slight bit of wobble but I moved around normally and I don't feel like it's going to collapse. Slight but of sag so if you are looking for extra firm, you should keep looking. I don't think you can do better for a cot that is less that $40.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Paco Morin

customer_reviews.title: Comfy and cozy
customer_reviews.text: We've used these several times in the hot and cold weather and enjoy the comfort. Though they are a little hard to set up the first time, they were much easier every time after. Great for packing into a site, though a little heavy for long trips. Love that it is low to the ground since my youngest is a wiggle worm when he sleeps, so when he fell off in the middle of the night, he continued to sleep and was uninjured, though he wasn't sure how he ended up on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Chris L.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping, NOT Hiking
customer_reviews.text: This is a great cot. Its very easy to put together and the stainless steel makes it much more rigid than your typical aluminum frames. I am only 5'7" but had plenty of space and loved the low profile. It does creak a bit if you toss and turn when you sleep, but no more than any other cot I've owned? I bought this cot for camping, not hiking, so if I could find one flaw with it, it is much too heavy for hiking. It still gets 5 stars for ease of assembly and sturdiness. It is well made and I suspect this cot will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Turner

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed with this cot.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my 11 year old for boy scout camp. The 2nd night, while he was sleeping, he fell through, when it ripped down the middle. He bought this with his own money, and was very careful with it. It looked like a good product to me, but apparently not.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Supportive for sore backs, setup not bad
customer_reviews.text: My husband has back problems and was very comfortable sleeping on this cot since it is quite firm and supportive. Setup requires some strength as the legs have to be muscled into the proper holes in the side pieces. I view this as a positive, however, since that is why the cot is so firm and supportive! Twin sheets fit this cot well, which is a plus for those who dislike sleeping bags. In addition, I like that it breaks down into such a small bag, easily stored in a car-top carrier for camping.
customer_reviews.author: piano teacher

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping!
customer_reviews.text: I didn't even look at the directions and was able to figure it out and put together in 10 minutes. This is better than the air mattress for camping! Plus, it disassembles easily into a carrying case, much like the a beach chair, except it feels lighter. Next time I camp, I'll order a couple more of these! May not be good for a larger sized person (width).
customer_reviews.author: Han

customer_reviews.title: Camp Cot
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a pain to put together. After you get it stretched out a few times it is ok. For the price it is a good bargain. It does sleep well but it is VERY closet to the ground. If you want a economical cot then this will work. If you want a higher unit off the ground and one that is very easy to assemble then I would get the Byer Easy Cot ( I have this one to but it is double the price). I got this one for my son so he doesn't get the best!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Long and Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a while for a camp bed that would a) fit me and b) be comfortable enough to sleep on for several days. This one fit those two requirements and more: it was affordable for the quality. It is a bit bouncy, but you get used to that soon enough. It is rock solid and really difficult to assemble - signs of good quality. If it were too easy to assemble, it meant it was loose and was going to fall apart. Not this one. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J Ogren

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy cot
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little cot. Easy to set up (though you do have to wrestle with the bars to get them into place), comfy, and withstands a beating from our kids. However, it is heavier than expected. I had anticipated being able to fly with it, but that's not really an option unless you have a designated duffle (it wouldn't fit in our largest suitcase) for the cot and bedding. Still, it's compact and great for camping or for kids.
customer_reviews.author: JoAnna

customer_reviews.title: A good product for camping
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry and is very compact, perfect for a kid or teenager to sleep on in a tent. The only complain I have is it is a little hard to put together, but as an engineer myself, I can't come up with any suggestion to improve it. There is always a trade off, you want a product that is well built, strong but compact, most likely you'll have to sacrifice convenience, it is for the field use anyway, if you want convenience, you should stay home.
customer_reviews.author: John W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a camping trip and to have a spare bed for the kids when friends come over. This was a great choice. It is compact, durable, and comfy. Remember to follow the instructions and push/pull as directed. If you do the opposite, yes you will have a hard time getting the stand in the rails. Follow the instructions and it is super easy.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Holmes

customer_reviews.title: throw out all of your air mattresses.  Wonderful alternative
customer_reviews.text: We have 6 of these. 4 for a family cabin and 2 for our home. My husband, who is 6' 3", sleeps comfortably on one. Pros: - small/compact storage - comfortable.......like a hammock - WAY better than air mattresses Cons: - easy to put together but it does take a few minutes. But, I think it is worth it because it is so comfortable
customer_reviews.author: JPeacock

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: We love these cots. This was our second one we purchased . Planning to buy one for the rest of the family before we camp again.
customer_reviews.author: JTP

customer_reviews.title: Good for camping indoors or out.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his hunting trip so he didn't have to worry about sleeping on the squeaky military cot we have. This works great and is easy to set up. My son has been using it in his bedroom for his "camping trip" he is taking in his room. This is very comfortable too.
customer_reviews.author: Wildian

customer_reviews.title: As comfortable as a cot can be
customer_reviews.text: Got one, tired it out, got a second one. Much lighter to carry and store than others I've tried. As comfortable as a cot can be. I use a Klymit Static V Lightweight Sleeping Pad with it and I'm fine. I'm almost 6' and over 200#. Very stable and plenty of room at head and feet.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Impressed....
customer_reviews.text: The reviews for this item were mixed, but I have to say that it surpassed my expectations. Assembly took a few minutes, but it seemed to be carefully made. All parts fit to pretty close tolerances, so are snug. That's a good thing. But I have to add that I found that in my absence my niece's two small children using this as a trampoline until I was able to correct that issue, and the cot resisted perfectly! I was impressed. I'd call this a "Good Buy".
customer_reviews.author: Shop Guy

customer_reviews.title: My younger daughter has slept on it and said it was comfortable but close to the ground
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter to use in college when she had people spend the night in her dorm room. It has served the purpose, plus she can keep it either in her room or her trunk for when ever she needs it. My younger daughter has slept on it and said it was comfortable but close to the ground. But she was happy to have something to sleep on.
customer_reviews.author: Gary/Cheri'

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price
customer_reviews.text: I really like these for camping outside. They pack up nicely and aren't too difficult to assemble. You do need a little power, but nothing obnoxious. I've used these on a few camping trips now, and I've never slept better; they're low enough to the ground to fit in my 4 person tent, and don't take up just enough room to keep me comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: theBatman

customer_reviews.title: Compact and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Compact and easy to use. This transforms the cold hard ground into a comfortable spot to rest one's head. The supports are shaped so that they spread weight without being pokey, meaning it seems safe to use with a floored tent that you don't want to poke holes into. Sleep tested and approved, easy to pack up and move with.
customer_reviews.author: Appalachian Techie

customer_reviews.title: Missing parts
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t receive all the parts needed for the frame. The storage bag was also ripped. I am returning this cot and will not buy another one.
customer_reviews.author: Bcopley1116

customer_reviews.title: Far too difficult to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Too difficult to set up. I understand from other reviews that the first time is the worst, but frankly, even if it got easier, this isn't worth doing. If it didn't need to be dismantled and reassembled after every use maybe then it would be OK. But for our needs, no way.
customer_reviews.author: Guy Stryder

customer_reviews.title: At least for one night!
customer_reviews.text: Camped in 33 degree weather with the Scouts. My son and I each used one. Kept warm off the ground (with enough cold weather sleeping gear), comfortable and no rocks or limbs in my back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: no more sinking through an airbed
customer_reviews.text: Sooo much better than an inflatable. Pretty easy to assemble,, but it does take some strength to flex the legs into the poles. All parts seem to be very high quality. Disassembles into a very easy to store canvas bag.
customer_reviews.author: Jared in IA

customer_reviews.title: Not as stiff as expected for a 160lb adult
customer_reviews.text: As mentioned by others, this cot is rather difficult to assemble with out some moderate muscle. In terms of sleep-ability, I was expecting a much stiffer surface at my 160lb weight. I also happen to be a stomach sleeper, and the sag in this cot made the first night a little uncomfortable. I'm sure this cot will see use, but I would have preferred spending a little extra for a stiffer sleep surface. This cot is mainly used a guest bed, and occasional camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Haley

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy setup!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for my kids. I already have a Coleman army style cot for myself and setting that thing up sucks. I wanted something easier for my kids and I got it with this cot. Some people are complaining about putting in the legs, but I had no problems whatsoever! It takes about 10 minutes, and it's sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Bauer

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat the price. Wasn't too difficult to put together, took less than 3 mins. And I'm a wimpy 40-something lady. Slept like a rock! This thing is seriously comfortable. Just hope it holds up for years to come....
customer_reviews.author: S. Kime

customer_reviews.title: Tsk
customer_reviews.text: The side bars don't even fit properly. I'm going to have to cut a slit to make them fit. I've waited long enough for it to arrive, I'm not going to bother to ship it back. This will only be used to basketball trip travels between school where the teams sleep in the school of the hosting town.
customer_reviews.author: AKlady

customer_reviews.title: Excellent cot for a three person tent
customer_reviews.text: Bought this cot for a seven day bike ride across North Carolina. I wanted a comfortable cot with low height for use in a three person tent. The cot was easy to set up and take down. I liked extra wide 30" width. If you're interested in this cot then check out the Cedar Ridge Air Sleeping Pad, Regular from ALPS Mountaineering. The sleeping pad is a perfect match for this cot!
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Okay, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: My grandchildren like sleeping on this, but it is less comfortable for adults. It is not easy to put together - it takes a lot of strength. Also, when set up, the corners are very sharp. Honestly, I wish I had purchased a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn TM

customer_reviews.title: Great Product that Exceeds Expectations
customer_reviews.text: Price aside, I really enjoy the cot: very comfortable, even with only a sleeping bag on top. Price considered, it's even better. The only downside is that it's a bit hard to get the first support in. Imdont know how to describe that any better, but I wouldn't let that stop you unless you have arthritis or something that severely reduces the strength in your hands. It's a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect cot for grandson while visiting. Was difficult to attach legs, but once I put on higher surface to get better angle, I got them inserted. Seems very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Baab

customer_reviews.title: I would really like this company to make a smaller size cot for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have this cot and used it multiple times. I would really like this company to make a smaller size cot for women and youth about 70 inches long and 22 inches wide. Also it would fit into the tents better, and pack down smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Tonyisme

customer_reviews.title: This is a wonderful product. I wanted to buy another one but ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product. I wanted to buy another one but the price doubled. I paid $25.00 and now its almost $50.00. Don't know why but I'm not buying another one when i paid only $25 for the 1st one. Im a big girl and it was very comfy and wide enough for me. Had room for a body pillow.
customer_reviews.author: Elisha

customer_reviews.title: Great cheap cot.
customer_reviews.text: This cot is great for what it is. Inexpensive, no frills, easy to set up, and easy when traveling. If you are expecting an amazing top of the line cot, you will likely be disjointed. It worked great for me on a recent 4 day hunting trip. Kept me off the ground and dry. I am 6'1" 190. If I was much bigger, it would probably be borderline too small, but I enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Bartmp

customer_reviews.title: Great indoor and outdoor
customer_reviews.text: I always had issues camping with my air mattress. A friend recommended using a portable cot, and it will change my perspective of camping. I got this particular cot to test the water. I tested with my family, and I am still using after 2 weeks of delivery. I got to say i am impressed. It isn't your bed at home, but it is way better than sleeping on an air mattress or with sleeping pad. This is based on my opinion. I ordered few more for my next camping trip with family. On the installation. It was difficult initially, but once you figured out the proper way it can be assemble less than 5 mins.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Chen

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing! I bought this as an alternative to an air mattress as I wanted something I wasn't going to have to replace constantly, but that I could keep in my truck for spontaneous travel. It's great! It's easy to put together and very comfortable, like sleeping on a hammock. I don't know how this would work for tall people - I am 5'4", 180 pounds and found it to be a great fit for me. I can stretch all the way out, I can sleep in my usual position, on my stomach, but also sleep fairly comfortably on my side.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

product_meta.title: Mountain Trails Base Camp Cot
product_meta.description: When you need a lightweight and compact cot for guests or for emergency purposes, look no further than the Mountain Trails Base Camp Cot. Weighing in at 9 pounds, 13 ounces, the Base Camp Cot is easy to transport and store with included carry bag. Measuring 74.8 x 30.3 x 6.7 inches, the Base Camp Cot is comfortable for any adult to sleep on.
feature_bullets: Weight Capacity: 225 pounds, You need to assemble the product.
Carry bag included for easy transport and storage
Carry bag included for easy transport and storage
